intro: Navarretia viscidula subsp. purpurea, commonly known as the purple sticky navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically covered in a sticky substance, which is a distinguishing feature. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas.
